commands.name: autochar
commands.short: Automagically creates a dicecloud sheet for you, with basic character information complete.
commands.docs: Automagically creates a dicecloud sheet for you, with basic character information complete.

commands.name: charref
commands.short: Gives you reference stats for a 5e character.
commands.docs: Gives you reference stats for a 5e character.

commands.name: randchar
commands.short: Makes a random 5e character.
commands.docs: Makes a random 5e character.

commands.name: randname
commands.short: Generates a random name, as per DMG rules.
commands.docs: Generates a random name, as per DMG rules.

commands.name: about
commands.short: Information about the bot.
commands.docs: Information about the bot.

commands.name: bug
commands.short: Reports a bug to the developer.
commands.docs: Reports a bug to the developer.

commands.name: donate
commands.short: Prints a link to donate to the bot developer.
commands.docs: Prints a link to donate to the bot developer.

commands.name: invite
commands.short: Prints a link to invite Avrae to your server.
commands.docs: Prints a link to invite Avrae to your server.

commands.name: ping
commands.short: Checks the ping time to the bot.
commands.docs: Checks the ping time to the bot.

modules.name: Customization
modules.desc: Commands to help streamline using the bot.

commands.name: alias
commands.short: Adds an alias for a long command.
commands.docs:
Adds an alias for a long command.
After an alias has been added, you can instead run the aliased command with !<alias_name>.
If a user and a server have aliases with the same name, the user alias will take priority.

subcommands.name: list
subcommands.short: Lists all user aliases.
subcommands.docs: Lists all user aliases.

subcommands.name: delete
subcommands.short: Deletes a user alias.
subcommands.docs: Deletes a user alias.

subcommands.name: deleteall
subcommands.short: Deletes ALL user aliases.
subcommands.docs: Deletes ALL user aliases.

commands.name: globalvar
commands.short: Commands to manage global, community variables for use in snippets and aliases.
commands.docs:
Commands to manage global, community variables for use in snippets and aliases.
If run without a subcommand, shows the value of a global variable.
Global variables are readable by all users, but only editable by the creator.
Global variables must be accessed through scripting, with `get_gvar(gvar_id)`.
See http://avrae.io/cheatsheets/aliasing for more help.

subcommands.name: create
subcommands.short: Creates a global variable.
subcommands.docs:
Creates a global variable.
A name will be randomly assigned upon creation.

subcommands.name: edit
subcommands.short: Edits a global variable.
subcommands.docs: Edits a global variable.

subcommands.name: editor
subcommands.short: Toggles the editor status of a user.
subcommands.docs: Toggles the editor status of a user.

subcommands.name: remove
subcommands.short: Deletes a global variable.
subcommands.docs: Deletes a global variable.

subcommands.name: list
subcommands.short: Lists all global variables for the user.
subcommands.docs: Lists all global variables for the user.

commands.name: multiline
commands.short: Runs each line as a separate command, with a 1 second delay between commands.
commands.docs:
Runs each line as a separate command, with a 1 second delay between commands.
Limited to 1 multiline every 20 seconds due to abuse.
Usage:
"!multiline
!roll 1d20
!spell Fly
!monster Rat"

commands.name: servalias
commands.short: Adds an alias that the entire server can use.
commands.docs:
Adds an alias that the entire server can use.
Requires __Administrator__ Discord permissions or a role called "Server Aliaser".
If a user and a server have aliases with the same name, the user alias will take priority.

subcommands.name: list
subcommands.short: Lists all server aliases.
subcommands.docs: Lists all server aliases.

subcommands.name: delete
subcommands.short: Deletes a server alias.
subcommands.docs:
Deletes a server alias.
Any user with permission to create a server alias can delete one from the server.

commands.name: servsnippet
commands.short: Creates a snippet to use in attack macros for the entire server.
commands.docs:
Creates a snippet to use in attack macros for the entire server.
Requires __Administrator__ Discord permissions or a role called "Server Aliaser".
If a user and a server have snippets with the same name, the user snippet will take priority.
Ex: *!snippet sneak -d "2d6[Sneak Attack]"* can be used as *!a sword sneak*.

subcommands.name: list
subcommands.short: Lists this server's snippets.
subcommands.docs: Lists this server's snippets.

subcommands.name: delete
subcommands.short: Deletes a server snippet.
subcommands.docs:
Deletes a server snippet.
Any user that can create a server snippet can delete one.

commands.name: snippet
commands.short: Creates a snippet to use in attack macros.
commands.docs:
Creates a snippet to use in attack macros.
Ex: *!snippet sneak -d "2d6[Sneak Attack]"* can be used as *!a sword sneak*.

subcommands.name: list
subcommands.short: Lists your user snippets.
subcommands.docs: Lists your user snippets.

subcommands.name: delete
subcommands.short: Deletes a snippet.
subcommands.docs: Deletes a snippet.

subcommands.name: deleteall
subcommands.short: Deletes ALL user snippets.
subcommands.docs: Deletes ALL user snippets.

commands.name: test
commands.short: Parses `str` as if it were in an alias, for testing.
commands.docs: Parses `str` as if it were in an alias, for testing.

commands.name: uservar
commands.short: Commands to manage user variables for use in snippets and aliases.
commands.docs:
Commands to manage user variables for use in snippets and aliases.
User variables can be called in the `-phrase` tag by surrounding the variable name with `{}` (calculates) or `<>` (prints).
Arguments surrounded with `{{}}` will be evaluated as a custom script.
See http://avrae.io/cheatsheets/aliasing for more help.

subcommands.name: remove
subcommands.short: Deletes a uvar from the user.
subcommands.docs: Deletes a uvar from the user.

subcommands.name: list
subcommands.short: Lists all uvars for the user.
subcommands.docs: Lists all uvars for the user.

subcommands.name: deleteall
subcommands.short: Deletes ALL user variables.
subcommands.docs: Deletes ALL user variables.

commands.name: monster_atk
commands.short: Rolls a monster's attack.
commands.docs:
Rolls a monster's attack.
Attack name can be "list" for a list of all of the monster's attacks.
Valid Arguments: adv/dis
                 -ac [target ac]
                 -b [to hit bonus]
                 -d [damage bonus]
                 -d# [applies damage to the first # hits]
                 -rr [times to reroll]
                 -t [target]
                 -phrase [flavor text]
                 crit (automatically crit)

commands.name: monster_check
commands.short: Rolls a check for a monster.
commands.docs:
Rolls a check for a monster.
Args: adv/dis
      -b [conditional bonus]
      -phrase [flavor text]
      -title [title] *note: [mname] and [cname] will be replaced automatically*
      -dc [dc]
      -rr [iterations]
      str/dex/con/int/wis/cha (different skill base; e.g. Strength (Intimidation))

commands.name: monster_save
commands.short: Rolls a save for a monster.
commands.docs:
Rolls a save for a monster.
Args: adv/dis
      -b [conditional bonus]
      -phrase [flavor text]
      -title [title] *note: [mname] and [cname] will be replaced automatically*
      -dc [dc]
      -rr [iterations]

commands.name: roll
commands.short: Rolls dice in xdy format.
commands.docs:
Rolls dice in xdy format.
Usage: !r xdy Attack!
       !r xdy+z adv Attack with Advantage!
       !r xdy-z dis Hide with Heavy Armor!
       !r xdy+xdy*z
       !r XdYkhZ
       !r 4d6mi2[fire] Elemental Adept, Fire
       !r 2d6e6 Explode on 6
       !r 10d6ra6 Spell Bombardment
       !r 4d6ro<3 Great Weapon Master
Supported Operators: k (keep)
                     ro (reroll once)
                     rr (reroll infinitely)
                     mi/ma (min/max result)
                     e (explode dice of value)
                     ra (reroll and add)
Supported Selectors: lX (lowest X)
                     hX (highest X)
                     >X/<X (greater than or less than X)

commands.name: multiroll
commands.short: Rolls dice in xdy format a given number of times.
commands.docs:
Rolls dice in xdy format a given number of times.
Usage: !rrr <iterations> <xdy> [args]

commands.name: iterroll
commands.short: Rolls dice in xdy format, given a set dc.
commands.docs:
Rolls dice in xdy format, given a set dc.
Usage: !rrr <iterations> <xdy> <DC> [args]

modules.name: GameTrack
modules.desc: Commands to help track game resources.

commands.name: cast
commands.short: Casts a spell.
commands.docs:
Casts a spell.
__Valid Arguments:__
-i - Ignores Spellbook restrictions, for demonstrations or rituals.
-l [level] - Specifies the level to cast the spell at.
**__Save Spells__**
-dc [Save DC] - Default: Pulls a cvar called `dc`.
-save [Save type] - Default: The spell's default save.
-d [damage] - adds additional damage.
**__Attack Spells__**
See `!a`.
**__All Spells__**
-phrase [phrase] - adds flavor text.

commands.name: customcounter
commands.short: Commands to implement custom counters.
commands.docs:
Commands to implement custom counters.
When called on its own, if modifier is supplied, increases the counter *name* by *modifier*.
If modifier is not supplied, prints the value and metadata of the counter *name*.

subcommands.name: create
subcommands.short: Creates a new custom counter.
subcommands.docs:
Creates a new custom counter.
__Valid Arguments__
`-reset <short|long|none>` - Counter will reset to max on a short/long rest, or not ever when "none". Default - will reset on a call of `!cc reset`.
`-max <max value>` - The maximum value of the counter.
`-min <min value>` - The minimum value of the counter.
`-type <bubble|default>` - Whether the counter displays bubbles to show remaining uses or numbers. Default - numbers.

subcommands.name: delete
subcommands.short: Deletes a custom counter.
subcommands.docs: Deletes a custom counter.

subcommands.name: summary
subcommands.short: Prints a summary of all custom counters.
subcommands.docs: Prints a summary of all custom counters.

subcommands.name: reset
subcommands.short: Resets custom counters, hp, death saves, and spell slots.
subcommands.docs:
Resets custom counters, hp, death saves, and spell slots.
Will reset all if name is not passed, otherwise the specific passed one.
A counter can only be reset if it has a maximum value.
Reset hierarchy: short < long < default < none
__Valid Arguments__
-h - Hides the character summary output.

commands.name: game
commands.short: Commands to help track character information in a game. Use `!help game` to view subcommands.
commands.docs: Commands to help track character information in a game. Use `!help game` to view subcommands.

subcommands.name: status
subcommands.short: Prints the status of the current active character.
subcommands.docs: Prints the status of the current active character.

subcommands.name: spellslot
subcommands.short: Views or sets your remaining spell slots.
subcommands.docs: Views or sets your remaining spell slots.

subcommands.name: longrest
subcommands.short: Performs a long rest, resetting applicable counters.
subcommands.docs:
Performs a long rest, resetting applicable counters.
__Valid Arguments__
-h - Hides the character summary output.

subcommands.name: shortrest
subcommands.short: Performs a short rest, resetting applicable counters.
subcommands.docs:
Performs a short rest, resetting applicable counters.
__Valid Arguments__
-h - Hides the character summary output.

subcommands.name: hp
subcommands.short: Modifies the HP of a the current active character. Synchronizes live with Dicecloud.
subcommands.docs:
Modifies the HP of a the current active character. Synchronizes live with Dicecloud.
If operator is not passed, assumes `mod`.
Operators: `mod`, `set`.

subcommands.name: thp
subcommands.short: Modifies the temp HP of a the current active character.
subcommands.docs:
Modifies the temp HP of a the current active character.
If positive, assumes set; if negative, assumes mod.

subcommands.name: deathsave
subcommands.short: Commands to manage character death saves.
subcommands.docs:
Commands to manage character death saves.
__Valid Arguments__
See `!help save`.

subcommands.name: success
subcommands.short: Adds a successful death save.
subcommands.docs: Adds a successful death save.

subcommands.name: fail
subcommands.short: Adds a failed death save.
subcommands.docs: Adds a failed death save.

subcommands.name: reset
subcommands.short: Resets all death saves.
subcommands.docs: Resets all death saves.

commands.name: spellbook
commands.short: Commands to display a character's known spells and metadata.
commands.docs: Commands to display a character's known spells and metadata.

subcommands.name: add
subcommands.short: Adds a spell to the spellbook override. If character is live, will add to sheet as well.
subcommands.docs: Adds a spell to the spellbook override. If character is live, will add to sheet as well.

subcommands.name: addall
subcommands.short: Adds all spells of a given level from a given class list to the spellbook override. Requires live sheet.
subcommands.docs:
Adds all spells of a given level from a given class list to the spellbook override. Requires live sheet.
If `spell_list` is passed, will add these spells to the list named so in Dicecloud.

subcommands.name: remove
subcommands.short: Removes a spell from the spellbook override. Must type in full name.
subcommands.docs: Removes a spell from the spellbook override. Must type in full name.

commands.name: help
commands.short: Shows this message.
commands.docs:
Shows this message.
<argument> - This means the argument is __**required**__.
[argument] - This means the argument is __**optional**__.
[A|B] - This means the it can be __**either A or B**__.
[argument...] - This means you can have multiple arguments.
Now that you know the basics, it should be noted that __**you do not type in the brackets!**__

modules.name: Homebrew
modules.desc: Commands to manage homebrew in Avrae.

commands.name: bestiary
commands.short: Commands to manage homebrew monsters.
commands.docs:
Commands to manage homebrew monsters.
When called without an argument, lists the current bestiary and the monsters in it.
When called with a name, switches to a different bestiary.

subcommands.name: list
subcommands.short: Lists your available bestiaries.
subcommands.docs: Lists your available bestiaries.

subcommands.name: delete
subcommands.short: Deletes a bestiary from Avrae.
subcommands.docs: Deletes a bestiary from Avrae.

subcommands.name: import
subcommands.short: Imports a published bestiary from [CritterDB](http://www.critterdb.com/).
subcommands.docs: Imports a published bestiary from [CritterDB](http://www.critterdb.com/).

subcommands.name: update
subcommands.short: Updates the active bestiary from CritterDB.
subcommands.docs: Updates the active bestiary from CritterDB.

modules.name: InitTracker
modules.desc:
Initiative tracking commands. Use !help init for more details.
To use, first start combat in a channel by saying "!init begin".
Then, each combatant should add themselves to the combat with "!init add <MOD> <NAME>".
To hide a combatant's HP, add them with "!init add <MOD> <NAME> -h".
Once every combatant is added, each combatant should set their max hp with "!init hp <NAME> max <MAXHP>".
Then, you can proceed through combat with "!init next".
Once combat ends, end combat with "!init end".
For more help, the !help command shows applicable arguments for each command.

commands.name: init
commands.short: Commands to help track initiative.
commands.docs: Commands to help track initiative.

subcommands.name: begin
subcommands.short: Begins combat in the channel the command is invoked.
subcommands.docs:
Begins combat in the channel the command is invoked.
Usage: !init begin <ARGS (opt)>
Valid Arguments: -dyn (dynamic init; rerolls all initiatives at the start of a round)
                 -name <NAME> (names the combat)
                 -turnnotif (notifies the next player)

subcommands.name: add
subcommands.short: Adds a combatant to the initiative order.
subcommands.docs:
Adds a combatant to the initiative order.
If a character is set up with the SheetManager module, you can use !init dcadd instead.
If you are adding monsters to combat, you can use !init madd instead.
Use !help init [dcadd|madd] for more help.
Valid Arguments:    -h (hides HP)
                    -p (places at given number instead of rolling)
                    -controller <CONTROLLER> (pings a different person on turn)
                    -group <GROUP> (adds the combatant to a group)
                    -hp <HP> (starts with HP)
                    -ac <AC> (sets combatant AC)
                    -resist/immune/vuln <resistance>

subcommands.name: madd
subcommands.short: Adds a monster to combat.
subcommands.docs:
Adds a monster to combat.
Args: adv/dis
      -b [conditional bonus]
      -n [number of monsters]
      -p [init value]
      -name [name scheme, use "#" for auto-numbering, ex. "Orc#"]
      -h (same as !init add, default true)
      -group (same as !init add)
      -npr (removes physical resistances when added)
      -rollhp (rolls monster HP)
      -hp [starting hp]
      -ac [starting ac]

subcommands.name: join
subcommands.short: Adds the current active character to combat. A character must be loaded through the SheetManager module first.
subcommands.docs:
Adds the current active character to combat. A character must be loaded through the SheetManager module first.
Args: adv/dis
      -b [conditional bonus]
      -phrase [flavor text]
      -p [init value]
      -h (same as !init add)
      --group (same as !init add)

subcommands.name: next
subcommands.short: Moves to the next turn in initiative order.
subcommands.docs:
Moves to the next turn in initiative order.
It must be your turn or you must be the DM (the person who started combat) to use this command.

subcommands.name: prev
subcommands.short: Moves to the previous turn in initiative order.
subcommands.docs: Moves to the previous turn in initiative order.

subcommands.name: move
subcommands.short: Moves to a certain initiative.
subcommands.docs:
Moves to a certain initiative.
`target` can be either a number, to go to that initiative, or a name.
If not supplied, goes to the first combatant that the user controls.

subcommands.name: skipround
subcommands.short: Skips one or more rounds of initiative.
subcommands.docs: Skips one or more rounds of initiative.

subcommands.name: list
subcommands.short: Lists the combatants.
subcommands.docs: Lists the combatants.

subcommands.name: note
subcommands.short: Attaches a note to a combatant.
subcommands.docs: Attaches a note to a combatant.

subcommands.name: opt
subcommands.short: Edits the options of a combatant.
subcommands.docs:
Edits the options of a combatant.
Valid Arguments:    -h (hides HP)
                    -p (changes init)
                    -name <NAME> (changes combatant name)
                    -controller <CONTROLLER> (pings a different person on turn)
                    -ac <AC> (changes combatant AC)
                    -resist <RESISTANCE>
                    -immune <IMMUNITY>
                    -vuln <VULNERABILITY>
                    -group <GROUP> (changes group)

subcommands.name: status
subcommands.short: Gets the status of a combatant or group.
subcommands.docs: Gets the status of a combatant or group.

subcommands.name: hp
subcommands.short: Modifies the HP of a combatant.
subcommands.docs:
Modifies the HP of a combatant.
Usage: !init hp <NAME> <mod/set/max> <HP>
If no operator is supplied, mod is assumed.
If max is given with no number, resets combatant to max hp.

subcommands.name: thp
subcommands.short: Modifies the temporary HP of a combatant.
subcommands.docs:
Modifies the temporary HP of a combatant.
Usage: !init thp <NAME> <HP>
Sets the combatant's THP if hp is positive, modifies it otherwise (i.e. `!i thp Avrae 5` would set Avrae's THP to 5 but `!i thp Avrae -2` would remove 2 THP).

subcommands.name: effect
subcommands.short: Attaches a status effect to a combatant.
subcommands.docs:
Attaches a status effect to a combatant.
[effect] is a set of args that will be appended to every `!i a` the combatant makes.
Valid Arguments: -b [bonus] (see !a)
                 -d [damage bonus] (see !a)
                 -ac [ac] (modifies ac temporarily; adds if starts with +/- or sets otherwise)

subcommands.name: re
subcommands.short: Removes a status effect from a combatant. Removes all if effect is not passed.
subcommands.docs: Removes a status effect from a combatant. Removes all if effect is not passed.

subcommands.name: attack
subcommands.short: Rolls an attack against another combatant.
subcommands.docs:
Rolls an attack against another combatant.
Valid Arguments: see !a and !ma.
`-custom` - Makes a custom attack with 0 to hit and base damage. Use `-b` and `-d` to add damage and to hit.

subcommands.name: aoo
subcommands.short: Rolls an attack of opportunity against another combatant.
subcommands.docs:
Rolls an attack of opportunity against another combatant.
Valid Arguments: see !a and !ma.
`-custom` - Makes a custom attack with 0 to hit and base damage. Use `-b` and `-d` to add damage and to hit.

subcommands.name: cast
subcommands.short: Casts a spell against another combatant.
subcommands.docs:
Casts a spell against another combatant.
__Valid Arguments__
-t [target (chainable)] - Required
-i - Ignores Spellbook restrictions, for demonstrations or rituals.
-l [level] - Specifies the level to cast the spell at.
**__Save Spells__**
-dc [Save DC] - Default: Pulls a cvar called `dc`.
-save [Save type] - Default: The spell's default save.
-d [damage] - adds additional damage.
adv/dis - forces all saves to be at adv/dis.
**__Attack Spells__**
See `!a`.
**__All Spells__**
-phrase [phrase] - adds flavor text.

subcommands.name: reactcast
subcommands.short: Casts a spell against another combatant.
subcommands.docs:
Casts a spell against another combatant.
__Valid Arguments__
-t [target (chainable)] - Required
-i - Ignores Spellbook restrictions, for demonstrations or rituals.
-l [level] - Specifies the level to cast the spell at.
**__Save Spells__**
-dc [Save DC] - Default: Pulls a cvar called `dc`.
-save [Save type] - Default: The spell's default save.
-d [damage] - adds additional damage.
adv/dis - forces all saves to be at adv/dis.
**__Attack Spells__**
See `!a`.
**__All Spells__**
-phrase [phrase] - adds flavor text.

subcommands.name: remove
subcommands.short: Removes a combatant or group from the combat.
subcommands.docs:
Removes a combatant or group from the combat.
Usage: !init remove <NAME>

subcommands.name: end
subcommands.short: Ends combat in the channel.
subcommands.docs: Ends combat in the channel.

modules.name: Lookup
modules.desc: Commands to help look up items, status effects, rules, etc.

commands.name: class
commands.short: Looks up a class, or all features of a certain level.
commands.docs: Looks up a class, or all features of a certain level.

commands.name: background
commands.short: Looks up a background.
commands.docs: Looks up a background.

commands.name: classfeat
commands.short: Looks up a class feature.
commands.docs: Looks up a class feature.

commands.name: condition
commands.short: Looks up a condition.
commands.docs: Looks up a condition.

commands.name: feat
commands.short: Looks up a feat.
commands.docs: Looks up a feat.

commands.name: item
commands.short: Looks up an item.
commands.docs: Looks up an item.

commands.name: lookup_settings
commands.short: Changes settings for the lookup module.
commands.docs:
Changes settings for the lookup module.
Usage: !lookup_settings -req_dm_monster True
Current settings are: -req_dm_monster [True/False] - Requires a Game Master role to show a full monster stat block.
                      -pm_result [True/False] - PMs the result of the lookup to reduce spam.
                      -srd [True/False] - toggles SRD lookup restriction in a server.

commands.name: monster
commands.short: Looks up a monster.
commands.docs:
Looks up a monster.
Generally requires a Game Master role to show full stat block.
Game Master Roles: GM, DM, Game Master, Dungeon Master

commands.name: race
commands.short: Looks up a race.
commands.docs: Looks up a race.

commands.name: racefeat
commands.short: Looks up a racial feature.
commands.docs: Looks up a racial feature.

commands.name: rule
commands.short: Looks up a rule.
commands.docs: Looks up a rule.

commands.name: spell
commands.short: Looks up a spell.
commands.docs: Looks up a spell.

commands.name: subclass
commands.short: Looks up a subclass.
commands.docs: Looks up a subclass.

commands.name: token
commands.short: Shows a token for a monster or player. May not support all monsters.
commands.docs: Shows a token for a monster or player. May not support all monsters.

modules.name: PBPUtils
modules.desc: Commands to help streamline playing-by-post over Discord.

commands.name: br
commands.short: Prints a scene break.
commands.docs: Prints a scene break.

commands.name: echo
commands.short: Echos a message.
commands.docs: Echos a message.

commands.name: embed
commands.short: Creates and prints an Embed.
commands.docs:
Creates and prints an Embed.
Arguments: -title [title]
-desc [description text]
-thumb [image url]
-image [image url]
-footer [footer text]
-f ["Field Title|Field Text"]
-color [hex color]
-t [timeout (0..600)]

commands.name: pythag
commands.short: Performs a pythagorean theorem calculation to calculate diagonals.
commands.docs: Performs a pythagorean theorem calculation to calculate diagonals.

commands.name: techo
commands.short: Echos a message, and deletes it after a few seconds.
commands.docs: Echos a message, and deletes it after a few seconds.

modules.name: Permissions
modules.desc:
Handles the bot's permission system.

This is how you disable or enable certain commands
for your server.

commands.name: disable
commands.short: Disables a command for this server. Case-sensitive.
commands.docs:
Disables a command for this server. Case-sensitive.

You must have Manage Server permissions or the
Bot Admin role to use this command.

commands.name: enable
commands.short: Enables a command for this server.
commands.docs:
Enables a command for this server.

You must have Manage Server permissions or the
Bot Admin role to use this command.

commands.name: prefix
commands.short: Sets the bot's prefix for this server.
commands.docs:
Sets the bot's prefix for this server.

You must have Manage Server permissions or the
Bot Admin role to use this command.

Forgot the prefix? Reset it with "@Avrae#6944 prefix !".

modules.name: SheetManager
modules.desc:
Commands to import a character sheet from [Dicecloud](https://dicecloud.com),
a [Google Sheet](https://gsheet.avrae.io), or a D&D Beyond PDF.

commands.name: attack
commands.short: Rolls an attack for the current active character.
commands.docs:
Rolls an attack for the current active character.
Valid Arguments: adv/dis
                 adv#/dis# (applies adv to the first # attacks)
                 -ac [target ac]
                 -b [to hit bonus]
                 -d [damage bonus]
                 -d# [applies damage to the first # hits]
                 -rr [times to reroll]
                 -t [target]
                 -c [damage bonus on crit]
                 -criton [a number to crit on if rolled on or above]
                 -phrase [flavor text]
                 -title [title] *note: [charname], [aname], and [target] will be replaced automatically*
                 -resist [damage resistance]
                 -immune [damage immunity]
                 -vuln [damage vulnerability]
                 -hit (automatically hits)
                 -miss (automatically misses)
                 crit (automatically crit)
                 ea (Elven Accuracy double advantage)
                 -f "Field Title|Field Text" (see !embed)
                 [user snippet]

commands.name: beyond
commands.short: Loads a character sheet from D&D Beyond, resetting all settings.
commands.docs: Loads a character sheet from D&D Beyond, resetting all settings.

commands.name: character
commands.short: Switches the active character.
commands.docs:
Switches the active character.
Breaks for characters created before Jan. 20, 2017.

subcommands.name: list
subcommands.short: Lists your characters.
subcommands.docs: Lists your characters.

subcommands.name: delete
subcommands.short: Deletes a character.
subcommands.docs: Deletes a character.

commands.name: check
commands.short: Rolls a check for your current active character.
commands.docs:
Rolls a check for your current active character.
Args: adv/dis
      -b [conditional bonus]
      -mc [minimum roll]
      -phrase [flavor text]
      -title [title] *note: [charname] and [cname] will be replaced automatically*
      -dc [dc]
      -rr [iterations]
      str/dex/con/int/wis/cha (different skill base; e.g. Strength (Intimidation))

commands.name: csettings
commands.short: Updates personalization settings for the currently active character.
commands.docs:
Updates personalization settings for the currently active character.
Valid Arguments:
`color <hex color>` - Colors all embeds this color.
`criton <number>` - Makes attacks crit on something other than a 20.
`reroll <number>` - Defines a number that a check will automatically reroll on, for cases such as Halfling Luck.
`srslots true/false` - Enables/disables whether spell slots reset on a Short Rest.
`embedimage true/false` - Enables/disables whether a character's image is automatically embedded.
`crittype 2x/default` - Sets whether crits double damage or dice.
`critdice <number>` - Adds additional dice for to critical attacks.

commands.name: cvar
commands.short: Commands to manage character variables for use in snippets and aliases.
commands.docs:
Commands to manage character variables for use in snippets and aliases.
Character variables can be called in the `-phrase` tag by surrounding the variable name with `{}` (calculates) or `<>` (prints).
Arguments surrounded with `{{}}` will be evaluated as a custom script.
See http://avrae.io/cheatsheets/aliasing for more help.
Dicecloud `statMod` and `stat` variables are also available.

subcommands.name: remove
subcommands.short: Deletes a cvar from the currently active character.
subcommands.docs: Deletes a cvar from the currently active character.

subcommands.name: deleteall
subcommands.short: Deletes ALL character variables for the active character.
subcommands.docs: Deletes ALL character variables for the active character.

subcommands.name: list
subcommands.short: Lists all cvars for the currently active character.
subcommands.docs: Lists all cvars for the currently active character.

commands.name: desc
commands.short: Prints or edits a description of your currently active character.
commands.docs: Prints or edits a description of your currently active character.

subcommands.name: update
subcommands.short: Updates the character description.
subcommands.docs: Updates the character description.

subcommands.name: remove
subcommands.short: Removes the character description, returning to the default.
subcommands.docs: Removes the character description, returning to the default.

commands.name: dicecloud
commands.short: Loads a character sheet from [Dicecloud](https://dicecloud.com/), resetting all settings.
commands.docs:
Loads a character sheet from [Dicecloud](https://dicecloud.com/), resetting all settings.
Share your character with `avrae` on Dicecloud (edit perms) for live updates.
__Valid Arguments__
`-cc` - Will automatically create custom counters for class resources and features.

commands.name: gsheet
commands.short: Loads a character sheet from [this Google sheet](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1etrBJ0qCDXACovYHUM4XvjE0erndThwRLcUQzX6ts8w/edit?usp=sharing), resetting all settings. The sheet must be shared with Avrae (see specific command help) for this to work.
commands.docs:
Loads a character sheet from [this Google sheet](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1etrBJ0qCDXACovYHUM4XvjE0erndThwRLcUQzX6ts8w/edit?usp=sharing), resetting all settings. The sheet must be shared with Avrae (see specific command help) for this to work.
Avrae's google account is `avrae-320@avrae-bot.iam.gserviceaccount.com`.

commands.name: portrait
commands.short: Shows or edits the image of your currently active character.
commands.docs: Shows or edits the image of your currently active character.

subcommands.name: update
subcommands.short: Updates the character portrait.
subcommands.docs: Updates the character portrait.

subcommands.name: remove
subcommands.short: Removes the character portrait, returning to the default.
subcommands.docs: Removes the character portrait, returning to the default.

commands.name: save
commands.short: Rolls a save for your current active character.
commands.docs:
Rolls a save for your current active character.
Args: adv/dis
      -b [conditional bonus]
      -phrase [flavor text]
      -title [title] *note: [charname] and [sname] will be replaced automatically*
      -image [image URL]
      -dc [dc] (does not apply to Death Saves)
      -rr [iterations] (does not apply to Death Saves)

commands.name: sheet
commands.short: Prints the embed sheet of your currently active character.
commands.docs: Prints the embed sheet of your currently active character.

commands.name: transferchar
commands.short: Gives a copy of the active character to another user.
commands.docs: Gives a copy of the active character to another user.

commands.name: update
commands.short: Updates the current character sheet, preserving all settings.
commands.docs:
Updates the current character sheet, preserving all settings.
Valid Arguments: `-v` - Shows character sheet after update is complete.
`-cc` - Updates custom counters from Dicecloud.
